messages.content:
Subject: FW: AI in Society - Invitation to [REDACTED]: Mailbox(name='[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de [TUS7HTL]', email_address='[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de', routing_type='SMTP', mailbox_type='Mailbox')
To: [REDACTED]@tum.de
CC: 
Date: 2024-07-18 11:58:27+00:00
Body:
Von: "[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de [TUS7HTL]" <[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de>
Datum: Donnerstag, 18. Juli 2024 um 13:57
An: "[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de [TUS7HTL]" <[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de>
Betreff: AI in Society - Invitation to [REDACTED]
Dear applicant,
Thank you for taking part in the aptitude test for the M.Sc. AI in Society at TUM on the 16th of July 2024. We have assessed your application and test scores, and as a result would like to invite you to the second stage of the aptitude assessment in the form of an interview.
During the aptitude interview, two members of the selection committee will discuss your motivation for choosing this degree program. They will also explore your willingness to engage in interdisciplinary learning and work, your professional interests, any previous specializations, and your professional background to assess how well these align with the goals of the program and your career aspirations. We will focus on understanding your motivation for the study program, not testing your knowledge on specific subjects.
The interviews will take place from July 22nd to July 30th and will be conducted online over Zoom.
How to select a timeslot:
Please use the following link: https://app.kulibri.com/pr/wDNpoAroZL4b/1BWn1BWnmarZw9zE
You will need to enter your email address as well as your full name. Please then choose one timeslot that works best for you. Try to refrain from selecting multiple timeslots, as they are limited. Each timeslot can only be selected by one person, therefore the distribution of slots works by the principle “first come, first serve”. Don’t forget to submit your answer after selecting.
Should you want to change your selection later, you will be able to do so yourself. However, please shortly let us know in case you had to change your slot (especially last minute).
As soon as you have selected a time slot, you can think of it as confirmed – there will be no additional email confirming your timeslot. You will receive your personal Zoom link at least 12 hours in advance to your interview. Before the conversation, please make sure everything works from your end (camera, microphone, internet connection).
If you have any questions about the procedure, please reach out to [REDACTED]@sot.tum.de<mailto:[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de>
We are looking forward to getting to know to you better!
---
[REDACTED]
PhD Candidate
Coordination TUM Master AI in Society
[REDACTED]
TUM School of [REDACTED] and Technology
https://www.gov.sot.tum.de/rds

[HEADER_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
[REDACTED],
To answer your questions:
  1.  The majority of the subjects will be held in the city center. Specifically, you will have your lectures in Richard-Wagner-Str.1, Marsstr. 20-22, and Arcisstr. 21.
  2.  The lecture type modules usually end with a final exam making up the entire grade. Some lectures (like Foundations of AI & [REDACTED]) also have an accompanying exercise with assignments, which can give bonus points to the final exam. In the seminar type modules, the examination can consist of a presentation, a small group project, or similar. This depends on the final decision of the lecturer.
  3.  Our program does not include internships in a fixed manner, i.e. they are not explicitly integrated into the study program and are not mandatory. However, you are of course welcome to complete an internship regardless during your studies, which is also highly recommended. Many students also work part-time in companies as so called “Werkstudent”. You might want to look into this, by searching up companies that interest you and looking for such Werkstudent vacancies.
  4.  No, this will not be a problem. You will be able to follow the content online, as the lectures will be streamed in parallel (e.g. via Zoom).
  5.  German language is not required for our Master’s program, as all modules are taught in English. But, of course, some knowledge of German will make life here easier for you. Please feel free to check out TUM’s language center: https://www.sprachenzentrum.tum.de/en/sz/homepage/
Best wishes
[NAME_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
---
[NAME_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
[HEADER_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
[HEADER_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
[REDACTED],
Thank you for your response. I would greatly appreciate your help in clarifying a few more questions:
1. [REDACTED]: Could you please confirm on which campus all my subjects will be held? I'm looking to find accommodation as close to the campus as possible to minimize commuting time.
2. [REDACTED]: Could you provide details on the evaluation system for each subject? For example, will there be a combination of assignments, projects, and a final exam? Additionally, what percentage of the final grade will be based on the final exam?.
3. [REDACTED]: Does the master’s program include internships to gain practical work experience in Germany? If so, when would these internships typically take place?.
4. [REDACTED]: I will need to travel to my home country from December 10th to 20th aprox. Would it be possible to attend classes online during this period without negatively affecting my performance?.
5. [REDACTED]: How relevant is proficiency in German for succeeding in the Master’s program and securing job opportunities related to the field? Also, does TUM offer German language courses as an extracurricular option included in the Master's program fees?
Thank you again for your assistance.
[HEADER_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
[REDACTED],
I think it will be no problem if you attend the courses online until end of October.
Regarding your questions: could you please collect them in an email for me? I will be out of office most of the time for the rest of August, but I will get back to your questions as fast as I can during this time.
Thank you and best wishes
[NAME_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
[HEADER_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
[HEADER_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
Good afternoon, [NAME_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY],
I have already booked the appointment for my visa in my country for September 4th. I read that the visa must be affixed to my passport, so I will need to wait in Chile until it is ready. The processing time is 6-8 weeks, so in the worst-case scenario, I might receive the visa by October 30th. Could I attend my course online until then?
Finally, I have some questions that I need your help with please. I have a meeting today with a student advisor, but she mentioned that many of my questions should be addressed by you since this is a new master's program.
Is it possible to book a 15-minute Zoom meeting with you?

El mar, 6 ago 2024 a las 22:56, Fabián Campos (<[REDACTED]@gmail.co[IMAGE_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]ailto:[REDACTED]@gmail.com>>) escribió:
[NAME_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY],
Thank you so much. It's a great solution you're suggesting because I wouldn't want to wait a year to start. Is it possible that once I apply for the study visa in my country, I can travel to Munich immediately on a tourist visa (up to 3 months), while waiting for my study visa? This way, I can attend classes in person.

[HEADER_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
[REDACTED],
I’m sorry to hear! Unfortunately, you cannot officially start in a summer semester. You could only defer it to next winter semester (if you have not yet accepted the offer online).
However, for the time being (while you are not yet in Munich), you can participate in the courses online. We will make sure they will all be streamed in parallel for people who could not make it here physically in time.
Does this work for you?
Best wishes
[NAME_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
---
[NAME_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
[HEADER_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
[HEADER_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
[REDACTED],
I hope this message finds you well. I have recently been informed that the processing time for a student visa takes 6-8 weeks, and the earliest available appointment in my country of residence, Chile, is on August 28th. This timeline means that I will not receive my visa in time to travel to Munich for the start of the October semester.
I am deeply disappointed by this situation as I was very much looking forward to starting my studies in October. Given the challenges involved in reapplying and the risk associated with it, I am seeking an alternative solution. Since I received my acceptance only a few days ago and am eager to join the program, could you please advise if it would be possible to defer my start date to the next summer semester?
Thank you very much for your understanding and assistance. I look forward to your response.

[HEADER_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
[REDACTED],
Ich kann Ihnen leider nicht sagen, wie lange die [REDACTED] noch braucht. 
[REDACTED] zum Semesterbeginn am 14.10. immer noch nicht immatrikuliert worden sein, melden Sie sich bitte kurz bei den Dozenten per Email und erklären [REDACTED]. Zum ersten Termin erscheinen Sie dann einfach. Sie können selbstverständlich trotzdem an den Veranstaltungen teilnehmen.
[REDACTED] sind bis ca. [REDACTED] offen. Bis dahin sollten Sie immatrikuliert worden sein, dann können Sie sich im Nachhinein offiziell für die Kurse einschreiben. Für die Übergangszeit, vernetzen Sie sich bitte mit [REDACTED], damit sie die Materialien der Kurse nicht verpassen (da Sie z.B. noch keinen Zugang zu Moodle haben werden).
Das oben nur zu [REDACTED] für den Fall - ich bin sicher, [REDACTED] ist bald durch.
[REDACTED]
--- 
[REDACTED] 
PhD Candidate
Coordination TUM Master AI in Society 
[REDACTED] 
TUM School of [REDACTED] and Technology 
https://www.gov.sot.tum.de/rds 
[HEADER_REDACTED_AUTOMATICALLY]
[REDACTED],
Ich habe alle noch fehlenden Unterlagen letzten Montag, 16.09. die TUM in der Arcisstraße geschickt. Leider hat es ziemlich lange gedauert bis ich mein Zeugnis beim KVR beglaubigen lassen konnte. 
Normalerweise sollte der Brief seit Mittwoch, 18.09. angekommen sein. Bisher hat sich der Status der Einschreibung noch nicht verändert. 
[REDACTED] wie lange die Fertigstellung der Einschreibung ca. dauert? Ich würde mich gerne zeitnah für den Blockkurs „Introduction to Programming and [REDACTED]“ anmelden. Hierfür ist meines Wissens meine Immatrikulation notwendig. 
Danke und

Subject: Re: AI in society aptitude test
Sender: Mailbox(name='[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de [TUS7HTL]', email_address='[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de', routing_type='SMTP', mailbox_type='Mailbox')
To: [REDACTED]@yahoo.com
CC: 
Date: 2024-06-24 08:54:17+00:00
Body:
[REDACTED],
Thank you for your email.
Please find some more specific topics on our website under “details about the test”: https://www.sot.tum.de/sot/studium/ai-in-society/application/
If you received a link for the moodle exam, you will also find a few test questions to get an idea of the final test.
Best wishes,
[REDACTED]
---
[REDACTED]
PhD Candidate
Coordination TUM Master AI in Society
[REDACTED]
TUM School of [REDACTED] and Technology
https://www.gov.sot.tum.de/rds
Von: [REDACTED] <[REDACTED]@yahoo.com>
Datum: Montag, 24. Juni 2024 um 07:14
An: "[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de [TUS7HTL]" <[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de>
Betreff: AI in society aptitude test
[REDACTED],
I hope this email finds you well.
I am currently preparing for the TUM entrance aptitude test for AI in Society. The test covers a broad range of topics including Politics and [REDACTED], Economics and Law, Statistics and Mathematics, and Engineering and [REDACTED]. Given the wide scope of these subjects, I would greatly appreciate it if you could provide some specific topics within these areas to focus on for my preparation.
Any guidance or suggestions on key areas of study would be immensely helpful.
Thank you for your support and assistance.

Subject: Re: Aptitude test
Sender: Mailbox(name='[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de [TUS7HTL]', email_address='[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de', routing_type='SMTP', mailbox_type='Mailbox')
To: [REDACTED]@gmail.com
CC: 
Date: 2024-06-18 09:40:18+00:00
Body:
[REDACTED],
Thank you for your email.
You can find the topics covered by the test on our website, please refer to the information given there: https://www.sot.tum.de/sot/studium/ai-in-society/application/
Best wishes
[REDACTED]
--- 
[REDACTED] 
PhD Candidate
Coordination TUM Master AI in Society 
[REDACTED] 
TUM School of [REDACTED] and Technology 
https://www.gov.sot.tum.de/rds
﻿Am 13.06.24, 07:59 schrieb "[REDACTED]" <[REDACTED]@gmail.com <mailto:[REDACTED]@gmail.com>>:
[REDACTED]. [REDACTED]!
My name is Bohdan and I have applied for the Master's programme "AI in
Society" at TUM.
I am writing to you, because I couldn't find the information on my
own. I have read that after applying I have to pass an aptitude test.
It is also written that the test aims to assess my knowledge in
politics, economics, maths, etc. I also read a file called
"Description of the aptitude assessment (appendix 2, German)".
However, there is no information there that I was looking for.
Could you please provide me with information on what topics will be
covered in the test? I mean what should I repeat from what I have
already studied in order to successfully pass the test? I am worried
about admission, therefore I want to score as high as possible, but it
is impossible without repetition.
I really hope for your understanding.
Yours faithfully,
[REDACTED]

Subject: Re: 2-[MANUALL_REDACTED] - Questions regarding the online application
Body:
[REDACTED],
To answer your questions:
  1.  In the form for “best 140 ECTS”, please refer to your bachelor’s transcript.
  2.  I would choose “Second degree” in this case, since it would be your second Master’s degree.
Best wishes
[REDACTED]

I hope this email finds you well.
My name is [REDACTED] (Stu-ID: 03751038), currently studying Robotics, Cognition, Intelligence (M.Sc.) in the 6th semester at TUM.
I would like to ask for my case (currently study master RCI at TUM), the application for AI for Society is “Consecutive masters courses” OR “Second degree”? FYI, I have two bachelor in Mechatronics.
Thank you very much for your support and help.
I look forward to receiving your reply.

Body:
Dear applicant,
Please use the following Zoom link for your AI in [REDACTED] on July 4th, 16:30-17:00 CEST.
https://[Zoom link redacted]
We look forward to getting to know you!
Best wishes

Body:
[REDACTED],
[REDACTED]. 2-[MANUALL_REDACTED] gibt es ein Problem bzgl. dem Englischnachweis (sie hat einen Nachweis über Auslandssemester hochgeladen; das stimmt, dass das nichts mit einem Englischnachweis zu tun hat).
Sie hat mich angeschrieben, ob eine auf englisch verfasste Bachelorarbeit auch als Nachweis gilt – nach Absprache intern haben wir beschlossen, dass das auch geht.
Nur zu deiner Information. Vermutlich wird die Bewerberin als nächstes einen Nachweis über englische bachelorarbeit hochladen, und das wäre für uns ausreichend.
Danke und

Body:
[REDACTED] & Team,
Könnt ihr bitte bei folgenden Bewerbern jeweils folgende Rückmeldung geben:
  *   1-00867711 [REDACTED] [Praxisprojekt]: „NOT OK: if you are naming university projects, please provide the respective module name/module number, so we can verify the module is part of your transcript and has the amount of ECTS indicated by you.“
  *   1-00866932 [REDACTED]
[Mathe/Statistik]: “NOT OK: Please provide module descriptions of the mentioned courses, which make the mathematics and/or statistics part of the modules apparent.”
[Praxisprojekt]: “NOT OK: Please provide module numbers/module names (as written in the transcript), if the named projects are university modules. Otherwise, please provide other proof, such as work certificates or similar, proving your projects.”
  *   1-00859983 [REDACTED] [Praxisprojekt]: “NOT OK: 1 credit = 1,4 ECTS. You have achieved 16,8 ECTS, which does not meet the requirement.”
  *   1-00863168 [REDACTED] [Mathe/Statistik]: “NOT OK: Please provide a module description of the mentioned course, which make the mathematics and/or statistics part of the module apparent.”
  *   1-00863859 [REDACTED] [Mathe/Statistik]: “NOT OK: Please provide a module description of the mentioned course, which make the mathematics and/or statistics part of the module apparent.”
  *   1-00858177 [REDACTED] [Praxisprojekt]: “NOT OK: Please provide module numbers/module names (as written in the transcript), if the named projects are university modules. Otherwise, please provide other proof, such as work certificates or similar, proving your projects.”
  *   1-00864806 [REDACTED] [Praxisprojekt]: “NOT OK: For projects outside of university, such as internships or work experience, please provide a work certificate or similar, stating a) the contents of your work, and b) the duration of your work. Otherwise, we cannot verify this experience.”
  *   1-00861001 [REDACTED] [Praxisrojekt]: “NOT OK: Please provide exact module numbers/module names (as written in the transcript), if the named projects are university modules. Also, your thesis project is not part of your transcript. We cannot verify the amount of credits.”
  *   1-00862511 [REDACTED] [Praxisprojekt]: “NOT OK: Please include a more in-depth description of what your work duties have encompassed. We need to be able to see a) the practical and b) the interdisciplinary aspect of your work in order to assess the good match for our study program. Please highlight these aspects in the provided form (in your own words), and reupload the improved document.”
[REDACTED]! Bitte um kurze Rückmeldung.
LG
[MANUALL_REDACTED]

Subject: Re: AI in Society - Clarification on [REDACTED]: Mailbox(name='[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de [TUS7HTL]', email_address='[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de', routing_type='SMTP', mailbox_type='Mailbox')
To: [REDACTED]@gmail.com
CC: 
Date: 2024-07-03 14:29:19+00:00
Body:
[REDACTED],
Thank you for your email and your high interest in our study program.
However, we are not allowed to accept documents sent to us by email. You needed to upload them in time to the application portal.
Best wishes
[REDACTED]
---
[REDACTED]
PhD Candidate
Coordination TUM Master AI in Society
[REDACTED]
TUM School of [REDACTED] and Technology
https://www.gov.sot.tum.de/rds
Von: [REDACTED] <[REDACTED]@gmail.com>
Datum: Mittwoch, 26. Juni 2024 um 12:44
An: "[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de [TUS7HTL]" <[REDACTED]@sot.tum.de>
Betreff: Re: AI in Society - Clarification on [REDACTED]
[REDACTED],
Thank you for your email.
Please guide me with the test link so I can proceed further with the test on a given time and date.
Furthermore, I couldn't upload one missing document within due time on my TUM portal.
Please find attached document proof of the projects at my bachelors time.
Regardless, it is very important for me to be a part of this prestigious institution. I dont want to miss out the admission in this institution so I request you to proceed my application for the next step in admission.
I shall be grateful to you for this act of kindness
Yours 
[MANUALLY REDACTED]
Degree programme
Master of Science | AI in Society (1. FS)
Start of course
Winter semester 2024/25
[REDACTED], 25 Jun 2024 at 06:05, [REDACTED] <[REDACTED]@tum.de<mailto:[REDACTED]@tum.de>> wrote:
Dear applicants of the M.Sc. AI in Society at TUM,
we are currently receiving many inquiries from people who have not yet received an invitation to the aptitude test tomorrow. We apologize for the confusion - the reason is the following:
we received a large number of applications, which we unfortunetely didn't manage to check in time for the test date on June 26th (tomorrow). Therefore, we have a group of people who did not receive any feedback from us yet.
We will proceed the following way: there will be a second test date on July 16th, from 10:45 - 12:15 CEST. Should you be one of the applicants who did not yet hear back from us (and were not declined either), please await further feedback regarding your application in the coming weeks from us. We will finish checking the remaining applicants and invite you to the second test, should all your documents suffice. You do not need to worry about the exam tomorrow.
If you already received an invitation to the test tomorrow, please ignore this email. For you, the test is still being held tomorrow.
We apologize for the confusion this might have caused and hope for your understanding.
Best wishes,
[REDACTED]
